law.text: An officer of the Kentucky National Guard shall hold his commission so long as he is entitled to federal recognition in that grade unless separated from the service prior to that time by reason of resignation, disability or for cause to be determined by a court-martial or efficiency board legally convened for that purpose.
law.history: Amended 1962 Ky. Acts ch. 47, sec. 5. -- Amended 1954 Ky. Acts ch. 98, sec. 7. -- Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. secs. 2711a-165, 2711a-171.
